AdditionalFields.Value: Clinical Research Excluding Trials,Prevention / Early Detection / Interception

Description: This session will cover the challenges and benefits of detecting precancerous lesions in the era of minimally invasive tests, like liquid biopsies.Dr. Castle will set the stage by discussing the following topics:1) Cervical cancer prevention as a model system: What did we learn and how can we apply those lessons to other cancers? 2) What is the NCI doing to characterize precancer?3) A precision cancer prevention framework anchored in the benefits-to-harms ratio to discuss the detection and management of precancerous conditions. Dr. Hawk will discuss:1) Merits and pitfalls of precancer discovery,2) Challenges in predictive analysis/interpretation, and3) High-risk cohorts.Dr. Papadopoulos will address and discuss:1) Technical and biological challenges for the detection of precancerous lesions,2) Examples of detecting precancerous lesions, such as adenomas and pancreatic cysts, and 3) Merits of detecting precancer lesions and the challenges with follow-up and intervention.
Location: La Nouvelle Orleans A-B, Convention Center
SearchResultBody: APRV02. Can Precancer Early Detection Become a Reality?
SearchResultFooter: La Nouvelle Orleans A-B, Convention Center
Title: Can Precancer Early Detection Become a Reality?
